    java.lang.String normalize​(java.lang.String pTerm)
    normalize will create a key out of the term The key is in reverse order, lowercased, and punctuation is replaced by spaces.
    java.lang.String stripLeadingPunct​(java.lang.String pKey)
    stripLeadingPunct This is a method that will have to take each token, examine the leading and trailing punctuation, and strip leading and trailing punctuation from each token

    • index

      index
      Parameters:

    • get

      public java.util.List<LexRecord> get​(java.lang.String pKey) throws java.lang.Exception
      get retrieves a list of terms given a key. Multiple records could be returned for a key based on case and part of speech. Note: The key is a string composed of the tokens of the term in reverse order. Also, punctuation has been replaced by spaces.
      Parameters:
      pKey -
      pNumberOfTokens -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • get

      public java.util.List<LexRecord> get​(int pNumberOfTokens, java.lang.String pKey) throws java.lang.Exception
      get retrieves lexical records given the number of tokens to look for, and a key. Note: The key is a string composed of the tokens of the term in reverse order. Also, punctuation has been replaced by spaces.
      Parameters:
      pNumberOfTokens -
      pKey -
      Returns:
      List
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception

    • normalize

      public java.lang.String normalize​(java.lang.String pTerm) throws java.lang.Exception
      normalize will create a key out of the term The key is in reverse order, lowercased, and punctuation is replaced by spaces.

      Returns:
